page.title: 05Cotswold Prehistoric Past
page.content: Flint artefacts dating from ancient times have long been prized by observant historians in the Cotswolds. These include flint tools, scrapers, borers and arrowheads, although hand axes are rare. Many finds are in the Ashmolean Museum Oxford and the Museum at Cheltenham. Local people also have good collections. Round and long barrows abound in this area. A field known as Cow Common on Swell Wold Farm has one long barrow and approx. 8 round tumuli, found to contain 10 adult burials, one infant, spoons and pottery. There is a round barrow at Huntsmans Quarry. Modern agricultural methods destroy some sites e.g. long barrow Slaughter Way field beside Condicote Lane. The Bristol & Gloucestershire Archeological Soc. keep information on the above, including aerial photos.
